english: to guide; to lead; to direct; to conduct

etymology.description: Simplified from 導 (道 → 巳); original 導 is phono-semantic: semantic 寸 (“hand”) + phonetic 道 (“path”).
etymology.interpretation: In the traditional form, a hand (寸) leads someone along a road (道), conveying the idea of guiding. The simplification replaces the complex 道 with 巳 to reduce strokes, keeping the hand component and core meaning while weakening the original phonetic cue.
etymology.simplification: Replaced the complex phonetic 道 with the simpler 巳 to lower stroke count while retaining the semantic 寸.

examples.chinese: 导游带我们参观故宫(導遊帶我們參觀故宮)。
examples.english: The tour guide led us to visit the Forbidden City.

examples.chinese: 他负责指导新员工(他負責指導新員工)。
examples.english: He is responsible for guiding the new employees.

examples.chinese: 这种材料能导电(這種材料能導電)。
